abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            National Agricultural Advisory Services Project for Uganda
            is to assist poor men and women farmers to become aware of,
            and to be able to adopt, improved technology and management
            practices in their farming enterprises so as to enhance
            their productive efficiency, their economic welfare, and the
            sustainability of their farming operations. The changes are:
            (a) reallocate project cost savings of about 20 percent to
            several categories of expenditure including the agricultural
            advisory services (AAS) grants for subproject category so as
            to scale up agricultural advisory service grants to 83
            districts and 1,033 sub counties, reaching over one million
            farm families by the end of the project period; (b) adopt
            simplified community based procurement procedures; (c)
            revise the project description and realign the component
            structure; and (d) refine and adjust the results framework.
